intro: Heracleum protheiforme var. elegans, commonly known as the slender cow parsnip, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-shaped clusters called umbels. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its sap contains irritants that can cause skin reactions in some individuals.
